respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.title: Respawn Delay Config
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_igno: If enabled, player operators/administrators will not be put in spectator mode on death.
If enabled, player in creative mode will not be put in spectator mode on death.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_keep: If enabled, players will keep their items on death, and no drop event will be ran. This will also ignore the 'dropItemsOnDeath' config.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_drop: If enabled, players will drop their items on death as normal vanilla behaviour.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_resp: If enabled, players will be respawned at the world spawn point. If disabled, they'll respawn wherever they're spectating.
If enabled, players will respawn when they logout while waiting for a respawn. Prevents players from getting stuck in spectator mode.
If enabled, players will respawn when they log in and are still in spectator mode. Prevents players from getting stuck in spectator mode.
The delay in seconds after which a spectating player will respawn. A value of -1 makes players never respawn automatically. The '/respawnall' command can still be used.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_onDe: The message which is sent to the player on death. Leave empty to disable.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_onRe: The message which is sent to players when they respawn. Leave empty to disable.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_wait: The message which is sent to players when they are waiting to be respawned. The text '<seconds_left>' will be replaced with the actual seconds left. Leave empty to disable.
respawndelay-fabric.duskconfig.DESC_lowe: When a player falls into the void, this determines the y position that's set after when a player enters spectator mode.
